radiographic_examinations.findings: A vascular retina in the better right eye; temporal avascularity with dragging of the temporal vessels to an area of fibrosis in the right eye; temporal retinal detachment (macula off) with dragging of the disc, macula, and retinal vessels toward an area of fibrosis in the temporal periphery of the left eye.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: The retinal detachment in the left eye progressed, and at 12 months, a temporal falciform retinal fold was evident.

radiographic_examinations.findings: A de novo microdeletion on chromosome 22q11.2 was found, confirming the diagnosis of DiGeorge syndrome.
